intro: Botor tetragonoloba, commonly known as the four-angle burr, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive quadrangular stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent pod that splits open to release its seeds. Botor tetragonoloba is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
